definition[0]: to move someone or something to another place, especially in a way that seems unfair
example[0]: Smith was shunted off to one of the companyâ€™s smaller offices.
definition[1]: to move a train or railway carriage onto a different track
definition[2]: an act of moving a train or railway carriage to a different track
definition[3]: a crash, especially in a car race
example[1]: His race ended after a shunt at the first corner.
